# Prerequisites 

1. Download **OpenMS** <a href="https://abibuilder.cs.uni-tuebingen.de/archive/openms/OpenMSInstaller/release/" target="blank"></a> for converting the format of MS2-files 

2. (optional) Download **WinSCP** <a href="https://winscp.net/eng/downloads.php></a> for transferring local files to server of GNPS

3. Export MS2-files as .mzML from $dataanalysis$

4. In order to install all essential packages, please run script **set_up_enviroment.R** under the folder of **J:\\CBMR\\SUN-CBMR-Metabolomics\\Workflow\\utils\\utils_MS2_set_up** before doing any step

5. If you would like to use tools on GNPS, please register for your personal username and password

6. You should replace values of variables with yours under the section ends with üïµÔ∏è

7. You could select whether run the section ends with ‚úàÔ∏è



```{r Flow chart for MS2-untargeted and -targeted workflow, echo=FALSE}

knitr::include_graphics(c("images/flow_chart_MS2_untarget.png",
                          "images/flow_chart_MS2_target.png"))



```

# File converter

The script `1.Pipeline_extension_format_converter.R` is available under the folder of `J:\CBMR\SUN-CBMR-Metabolomics\Workflow\Script\modules` 



## Source paths on the server




## Specify the polarity üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}

```

  

## Path of application of openms üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
path_openms <- "C:/Program Files/OpenMS-2.8.0/bin"
```

  
    
    
## Path of storing files (.mzML) exported from dataanalysis for each polarity üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
path_files_from_DA <- "H:/From_SUND/Scripts/test/MS2pos_untarget"
```

    
    




## Conduct
### Add extension (**if not available**) to files exported from dataanalysis
```{r eval=FALSE}
files_from_DA <- list.files(path_files_from_DA, full.names = TRUE)
id_not_ext <- setdiff(1:length(files_from_DA), 
                      grep("\\.mzML$|\\.d$", basename(files_from_DA)))


if (length(id_not_ext) != 0) {
  

  file.rename(files_from_DA[id_not_ext],
              paste0(files_from_DA[id_not_ext], ".mzML")
             )
}
    
```

    
    
    
### File converter for adapting to run XCMS
```{r eval=FALSE}
source(paste0(path_func, "/file-conversion.R"))

#Create a sibling folder for storing files from openms
path_files_from_openms <- paste0(dirname(path_files_from_DA), "/mzML_openms_MS2_", polarity)
if (!dir.exists(file.path(path_files_from_openms))) dir.create(path_files_from_openms, showWarnings = FALSE, recursive = TRUE)

#conduct converting  
mapply(function(x, y) file_conversion(x,y, path_openms, ".mzML", ".mzML"), path_files_from_openms, path_files_from_DA)
```

# MS2 preprocessing untargeted
## XCMS
   The script `2a.Pipeline_XCMS.R` is available under the folder of `J:\CBMR\SUN-CBMR-Metabolomics\Workflow\Script\modules\MS2_preprocessing`




### Source paths on the server
```{r eval=FALSE}
source("H:/From_SUND/Scripts/utils/utils_MS2_set_up/set_up_paths.R")
```



### Provide polarity üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
polarity <- "POS"
```

   
   
   
### Path of storing .mzML files (**!!! have transferred by OpenMS**) üïµ 
```{r eval=FALSE}
path_files_mzML <- "H:/From_SUND/Scripts/test/mzML_openms_MS2_POS"
```

   
  

### Path of storing outputs üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
path_outputs <- "H:/From_SUND/Scripts/outputs"
```

   
   
   
### Parameters for preprocessing üïµ
#### Filter the compounds eluted too early and too late üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
rt_range <- c(0.5, 15)*60 
```

   
   
#### Peak picking üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
    library(xcms)


    params <- list()
   
    params$CentWave <- CentWaveParam( ppm = 20,
                                      peakwidth =  c(0.05,0.2)*60,
                                      snthresh = 5,
                                      noise = 1500,
                                      prefilter = c(3,1500),
                                      integrate = 2,
                                      mzdiff = -0.001,
                                      verboseColumns = TRUE,
                                      fitgauss = TRUE,
                                      extendLengthMSW = TRUE
    )
```

    
   
#### Grouping for alignment üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
    params$group1 <- PeakDensityParam( sampleGroups = rep(1, length(list.files(path_files_mzML))),
                                       binSize = 0.01,
                                       bw = 2,
                                       minSamples = 1,
                                       minFraction = 0.3,
                                       maxFeatures = 20
    )
```

   
   
#### Alignment üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
    params$PeakAlign <- PeakGroupsParam(  smooth = "loess",
                                          span = 0.6,
                                          minFraction    = 0.8,
                                          family = "gaussian",
                                          extraPeaks = 3
                                          #subset = 
    )
```

   
   
#### Grouping again with stricter condition after alignment üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
    params$group2 <- PeakDensityParam( sampleGroups = rep(1, length(list.files(path_files_mzML))),
                                       binSize = 0.01,
                                       bw = 1.8,
                                       minSamples = 1,
                                       minFraction = 0.6,
                                       maxFeatures = 20
    )
```

   
   
#### Gap filling üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
    params$FillChromPeaksParam <- FillChromPeaksParam(expandMz = 0, 
                                                      expandRt = 0, 
                                                      ppm = 30)
   
```

   
   
#### Conducting XCMS
```{r eval=FALSE}
    raw <- readMSData(list.files(path_files_mzML, full.names = TRUE), 
                      mode = "onDisk")
   
   
   
    source(paste0(path_utils_prepro, "/XCMS.R"))
```

   
   
   
   
   
   
   
   
   
   
## Extraction of MS2-spectra
   The script `3a.Pipeline_extract_MS2.R` is available under the folder of `J:\CBMR\SUN-CBMR-Metabolomics\Workflow\Script\modules\MS2_preprocessing`
   


### Source paths on the server
```{r eval=FALSE}
source("H:/From_SUND/Scripts/utils/utils_MS2_set_up/set_up_paths.R")
```



### Provide the polarity üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
polarity <- "POS" #or "NEG"
```



### Path of XCMSnExp object after conducting XCMS üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}

```


   
### Path of storing outputs üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
path_outputs <- "H:/From_SUND/Scripts/outputs"
```

 
   
### Parameters for extracting MS2 spectra üïµ
#### Extraction: Threshold of rt and m/z for extraction and what type of object return üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
params <- list()
params$expandRt <- 15
params$expandMz <- 0.01
params$return.type <- "Spectra"  #"MSpectra", "list", "List"
```

   
   
### Combining: Threshold of mz, proportion among all samples, type for combining, function for combining mz and intensity üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
# for getting consensus spectra for each feature at each collision energy
params$tolerance <- 0.005
params$peaks <- "intersect"  #"union" #report all peaks from all input spectra 
params$minProp <- 0.7
params$intfun <- median
params$mzfun <- median
```

   
   
### (Optional but recommended) Plot the MS2 spectra ‚úàÔ∏è


   
   
### (Optional but reconmended) Reduce the number of the MS2 spectra ‚úàÔ∏è
<div class="Keats_red">**If not, please do not run these two lines**</div>
```{r eval=FALSE}
npeaks_reduce <- "TRUE"
npeaks_remaining <- 60
```



   
### Conduct the extraction of MS2 spectra 
```{r eval=FALSE}
source(paste0(path_utils_prepro, "/extract_MS2.R"))
```


   
   





## (Optional) CAMERA
<font color = "red">If you would like to get more information related to adduct, please run these lines, but you have to have at least **6** samples</font>

   The script `4.(optional)Pipeline_CAMERA.R` is available under the folder of `J:\CBMR\SUN-CBMR-Metabolomics\Workflow\Script\modules\MS2_preprocessing`
   
   
   
### Source paths on the server
```{r eval=FALSE}
source("H:/From_SUND/Scripts/utils/utils_MS2_set_up/set_up_paths.R")
```




### Provide the polarity üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
polarity <- "POS"
```

  

### Path of storing outputs üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
path_outputs <- "H:/From_SUND/Scripts/outputs"
```


   
### Read XCMSnExp object after conducting XCMS üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
path_rds_xcms_XCMSnExp <- "H:/From_SUND/Scripts/outputs/xcms_XCMSnExp_POS.rds" 
```

 
### Parameters for CAMERA üïµ
#### Grouping üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
params <- list()
params$perfwhm <- 0.6          #percentage of the width of the FWHM (full width at half maximum) of the peak
params$group_intval <- "into"  #the type of intensity value
params$sigma <- 6              #multiplier of the standard deviation
```

   
   
#### correlation üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
params$calcIso <- FALSE      #include isotope detection information for graph clustering
params$calcCiS <- FALSE      #calculate correlation inside samples
params$calsCaS <- TRUE       #calculate correlation across samples
params$cor_eic_th <- 0.7     #correlation threshold for RIC correlation
params$cor_exp_th <- 0.3     #threshold for intensity correlations across samples
params$pval <- 1E-6          #p-value threshold for testing correlation of significance
params$graphMethod <- "lpc"  #clustering method for resulting correlation graph (hcs, lpc)
params$intval_cor <- "into"  #selection of the intensity values
```

   
   
#### find isotopes üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
params$find_isoto_ppm <- 10         #threshold for m/z
params$mzabs <- 0.01                #allowed variance for the search
params$find_isoto_intval <- "into"  #choose intensity values for C12/C13 check
```

   
   
   
#### find adducts üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
params$find_addu_ppm <- 10    
params$mzabs <- 0.01
params$multiplier <- 4         #highest number(n) of allowed clusterion [nM+ion]
   
```


   
### Conduct CAMERA
```{r eval=FALSE}
source(paste0(path_utils_prepro, "/CAMERA.R"))
     
```

# MS2-Annotation
This chapter consists of: 

1. Submit job of CMN and jobs based on CMN on GNPS (involved uploading files to the server of GNPS) 

2. Submit job of FBMN and jobs based on FBMN on GNPS (involved uploading files to the server of GNPS)

3. Download all results from all submitted jobs and merge into a large table  

4. Compare MS2-experimental data with our in-house library 

5. Merge the results obtained from each GNPS-job and library-match into one table





## GNPS-Submit jobs based on CMN
The script `1b.Pipeline_GNPS_upload_submitjobs_based on CMN.R` is available under the folder of `J:\CBMR\SUN-CBMR-Metabolomics\Workflow\Script\modules\MS2_Annotation`

<div class="Keats">The pipeline is for:

1.Uploading files to the server of GNPS.

2.Generating parameters for each job you would like to run.

3.Running CMN (classic molecular network) and a couple of other jobs based on CMN on GNPS.

4.Changing the parameters related to the jobs you would like to run.

5.Please pay attention to the filenames <font color = "red">**no space within each filename**</font>
</div>



### Upload files
#### Source paths on the server and relevant function
```{r eval=FALSE}
source("H:/From_SUND/Scripts/utils/utils_MS2_set_up/set_up_paths.R")
source(paste0(path_func, "/files_by_FTP.R"))
```

 

#### Provide polarity (upper case) üïµ


### [CMN](https://ccms-ucsd.github.io/GNPSDocumentation/networking/) 
#### Generate parameters üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
parameters_CMN <- list()
parameters_CMN["precursor_ion_mass_tolerance"] <- "0.02"
parameters_CMN["fragment_ion_mass_tolerance"] <- "0.02"
parameters_CMN["min_pairs_cos"] <- "0.7"
parameters_CMN["minimum_matched_fragment_ions"] <- "6"
parameters_CMN["maximum_shift"] <- "500"
parameters_CMN["network_topk"] <- "10"
parameters_CMN["minimum_cluster_size"] <- "2"
parameters_CMN["run_mscluster"] <- "on" 
parameters_CMN["maximum_connected_component_size"] <- "100"
parameters_CMN["library_search_min_matched_peaks"] <- "6"
parameters_CMN["score_threshold"] <- "0.7"
parameters_CMN["search_analogs"] <- "0" 
parameters_CMN["maximum_analog_search_mass_difference"] <- "100" 
parameters_CMN["filter_below_std_dev"] <- "0.0"
parameters_CMN["minimum_peak_intensity"] <- "0.0"
parameters_CMN["filter_precursor_window"] <- "1"
parameters_CMN["filter_library"] <- "1" 
parameters_CMN["filter_peaks_10_50Da_window"] <- "1" 
parameters_CMN["filter_spectra_from_G6_as_blanks_before_networking"] <- "0" 
parameters_CMN["find_related_datasets"] <- "0" 
parameters_CMN["create_cluster_buckets_and_qiime2_biom_pcoa_plots_output"] <- "1" 
parameters_CMN["create_ili_mapping_output"] <- "0"
```

     

#### Submit CMN
```{r eval=FALSE}

```




### [Dereplicator](https://ccms-ucsd.github.io/GNPSDocumentation/dereplicator/) 
#### Generate parameters üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
parameters_CMN_Dereplicator <- list()
parameters_CMN_Dereplicator["precursor_ion_mass_tolerance"] <- "0.02"
parameters_CMN_Dereplicator["search_analogs"] <- "on" # if you do not select, just leave it empty like ""
parameters_CMN_Dereplicator["fragment_ion_mass_tolerance"] <- "0.02"
parameters_CMN_Dereplicator["pnp_database"] <- "pnpdatabase" # "dmisam" for "Extended", "combined" for "Regular"
parameters_CMN_Dereplicator["max_charge"] <- "2"
parameters_CMN_Dereplicator["accurate_p_values"] <- "on" # leave it empty, like "", if you do not select it
parameters_CMN_Dereplicator["min_number_of_AA"] <- "5"
parameters_CMN_Dereplicator["max_isotopic_shift"] <- "0" # other options are "1", "2"
parameters_CMN_Dereplicator["adducts_Na"] <- "" # if select, give the value like "on"
parameters_CMN_Dereplicator["adducts_K"] <- ""  # if select, give the value like "on"
parameters_CMN_Dereplicator["max_allowed_modification_mass"] <- "150" 
parameters_CMN_Dereplicator["min_matched_peaks_with_known_compounds"] <- "5"
```

### [NAP](https://ccms-ucsd.github.io/GNPSDocumentation/nap/) 
#### Generate parameters üïµ  
<font color = "red">\*parameters are different from different polarities</font>
```{r eval=FALSE}
parameters_CMN_NAP <- list()
parameters_CMN_NAP["number_of_a_cluster_index"] <- "0"
parameters_CMN_NAP["cosine_value_to_subselect_inside_a_cluster"] <- "0.7" 
parameters_CMN_NAP["n_first_candidates_for_consensus_score"] <- "10"
parameters_CMN_NAP["use_fusion_result_for_consensus"] <- "on" # if deselect, ""
parameters_CMN_NAP["accuracy_for_exact_mass_candidate_search_ppm"] <- "15"
parameters_CMN_NAP["structure_database"] <- "GNPS,HMDB,SUPNAT,NPAtlas,CHEBI,DRUGBANK,FooDB" 
parameters_CMN_NAP["maximum_number_of_candidate_structures_in_the_graph"] <- "10"
```

     
<font color = "red">Be careful the inputs of parameters depending on the polarity, so only change the inputs related to the polarity you are working on</font>

```{r eval=FALSE}
if (polarity == "POS") {
  
  parameters_CMN_NAP["acquisition_mode"] <- "Positive"
  parameters_CMN_NAP["adduct_ion_type"] <- "[M+H]" # other options are "[M]","[M+NH4]","[M+Na]","[M+K]", "[M+ACN+H]" 
  parameters_CMN_NAP["multiple_adduct_types"] <- "[M+Na]" 

  } else if (polarity == "NEG") {
    parameters_CMN_NAP["acquisition_mode"] <- "Negative" 
    parameters_CMN_NAP["adduct_ion_type"] <- "[M-H]" # other options are "[M+Cl]", "[M+FA-H]"
    parameters_CMN_NAP["multiple_adduct_types"] <- "[M+Cl]"
                
  }   
```

      
#### Submit NAP
```{r eval=FALSE}
source(paste0(path_utils_annotation, "/GNPS_upload_submitjobs.R"))
```


 
  
### [MS2LDA](https://ccms-ucsd.github.io/GNPSDocumentation/ms2lda/) 
#### Generate parameters üïµ  

<font color = "red">If the polarity is negative mode, recommend to exclude all motif by changing values from "yes" to "no" </font>


```{r eval=FALSE}
parameters_CMN_MS2LDA <- list()
```

<font color = "red">2. Change the parameters in the sections below related to the workflows you would like to run</font>

#### [FBMN](https://ccms-ucsd.github.io/GNPSDocumentation/featurebasedmolecularnetworking/)
##### Generate parameters üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
parameters_FBMN <- list()
parameters_FBMN["precursor_ion_mass_tolerance"] <- "0.02"
parameters_FBMN["fragment_ion_mass_tolerance"] <- "0.02"
parameters_FBMN["min_pairs_cos"] <- "0.7"
parameters_FBMN["minimum_matched_fragment_ions"] <- "6"
parameters_FBMN["maximum_shift"] <- "500"
parameters_FBMN["network_topk"] <- "10"
parameters_FBMN["maximum_connected_component_size"] <- "100"
parameters_FBMN["library_search_min_matched_peaks"] <- "6"
parameters_FBMN["score_threshold"] <- "0.7"
parameters_FBMN["search_analogs"] <- "0" # don't search/ "1" search
parameters_FBMN["maximum_analog_search_mass_difference"] <- "100" # it only works once select the search analog
parameters_FBMN["top_results_to_report_per_query"] <- "1"
parameters_FBMN["minimum_peak_intensity"] <- "0.0"
parameters_FBMN["filter_precursor_window"] <- "1" # filter / "0" don't filter
parameters_FBMN["filter_library"] <- "1" # filter / "0" don't filter
parameters_FBMN["filter_peaks_10_50Da_window"] <- "1" # filter / "0" don't filter
parameters_FBMN["normalization_per_file"] <- "None" # represent no normalization, the other option is "RowSum"
parameters_FBMN["aggregation_method_for_peak_abundances_per_group"] <- "Mean" # another option is "Sum"
parameters_FBMN["pcoa_distance_metric"] <- "cosine" # other options are "braycurtis", "euclidean", "jaccard"
parameters_FBMN["metadata_column_to_compare"] <- "None"
parameters_FBMN["run_stats_and_plots"] <- "No" # other option is "Yes"
parameters_FBMN["metadata_field_to_compare_1"] <- "None"
parameters_FBMN["metadata_field_to_compare_2"] <- "None"
parameters_FBMN["metadata_column_to_facet"] <- "None"
parameters_FBMN["run_Dereplicator"] <- "1" # "0" represent don't run and "1" represents run
```


##### Submit FBMN
```{r eval=FALSE}
source(paste0(path_utils_annotation, "/GNPS_upload_submitjobs.R"))
```

<font color = "red">\*parameters are different from different polarities</font>

##### Generate parameters üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
parameters_FBMN_NAP <- list()
parameters_FBMN_NAP["number_of_a_cluster_index"] <- "0"
parameters_FBMN_NAP["cosine_value_to_subselect_inside_a_cluster"] <- "0.7" 
parameters_FBMN_NAP["n_first_candidates_for_consensus_score"] <- "10"

parameters_FBMN_NAP["accuracy_for_exact_mass_candidate_search_ppm"] <- "15"
parameters_FBMN_NAP["structure_database"] <- "GNPS,HMDB,SUPNAT,NPAtlas,CHEBI,DRUGBANK,FooDB" 
parameters_FBMN_NAP["maximum_number_of_candidate_structures_in_the_graph"] <- "10"
```

     
<font color = "red">Be careful the inputs of parameters depending on the polarity, so only change the inputs related to the polarity you are working on</font>
```{r eval=FALSE}
if (polarity == "POS") {
  
  parameters_FBMN_NAP["acquisition_mode"] <- "Positive"
  parameters_FBMN_NAP["adduct_ion_type"] <- "[M+H]" # other options are "[M]", "[M+NH4]", "[M+Na]", "[M+K]", "[M+ACN+H]" 
  parameters_FBMN_NAP["multiple_adduct_types"] <- "[M+Na]" 

} else if (polarity == "NEG") {
  
  parameters_FBMN_NAP["acquisition_mode"] <- "Negative" 
  parameters_FBMN_NAP["adduct_ion_type"] <- "[M-H]" # other options are "[M+Cl]", "[M+FA-H]"
  parameters_FBMN_NAP["multiple_adduct_types"] <- "[M+Cl]"
                
}  
```


##### Submit NAP
```{r eval=FALSE}
source(paste0(path_utils_annotation, "/GNPS_upload_submitjobs.R"))
```

```{r eval=FALSE}
source(paste0(path_func, "/Merge_outputs_from_GNPS.R"))
```

 

#### Provide the path of storing files downloaded from GNPS üïµ
<font color = "red">The path should be end with **gnps_outputs**</font>
```{r eval=FALSE}
path_downloaded_files <- "H:/From_SUND/Scripts/outputs/workflow_test_1_serum_metabolomics_RF/gnps_outputs"
```



#### Provide the absolute path of "list of job ids" by including the name of that list  üïµ
<font color = "red">name should start with **list_jobid_GNPS**</font>
```{r eval=FALSE}

```



#### Provide path for storing the merged result üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}

```

<font color = "red">If you run jobs based on CMN, skip running the line below</font>



#### Conduct
```{r eval=FALSE}
library(dplyr)

list_jobid <- readRDS(path_list)
workflow_all <- names(list_jobid) %>% gsub("_task_id", "",.) 
workflow <- workflow_all[grepl(workflow_based, workflow_all)] %>% strsplit("[A-Z]+_") %>% unlist() %>% unique() %>% na_if("") %>% na.omit() 

if (workflow_based == "FBMN") {
  
  Merge_outputs_from_GNPS(path_downloaded_files, prep_method, workflow, polarity, path_outputs)
  
} else if (workflow_based == "CMN") {
  
  Merge_outputs_from_GNPS(path_downloaded_files, NULL, workflow, polarity, path_outputs)
  
}


```

# Small tools
This chapter consists of: 

1. Among compound name, if you have any one as identifier (PubChem id (cid), KEEG id, HMDB, CAS), you will get the rest of them and corresponding chemical properties related to this compound


<font color = "red">Copy excel file under the folder of **utils_DBs_api**, replace the context of identifier as yours. e.g. If your identifier is PubChem_CID, choose the sheet name as PubChem_CID, replace the context of PubChem_CID numbers as yours</font>




## Play with various ids
The script `DBs_ids_properties.R` is available under the folder of `J:\CBMR\SUN-CBMR-Metabolomics\Workflow\Script\modules`


### Source paths on the server
```{r eval=FALSE}
source("H:/From_SUND/Scripts/utils/utils_MS2_set_up/set_up_paths.R")
```



### Provide identifier for grabbing other information üïµ
<font color = "red">You have to choose one from these 5 options **("PubChem_CID", "Compound_Name", "KEGG", "CAS", "HMDB")**</font>
```{r eval=FALSE}
identifier <- "PubChem_CID" 
```



### Provide filename and sheetname for searching other information üïµ
absolute path
```{r eval=FALSE}
filename_xlsx <- "H:/From_SUND/Scripts/test/test_DB_ids.xlsx"
```



### What properties you would like to get üïµ
You could find other options from function `get_info_based_cid_to_xlsx.R` under the folder of containing functions
```{r eval=FALSE}
properties <- c("IUPACName", "InChIKey", "CanonicalSMILES", "MonoisotopicMass")
```


### Provide the path for containing output üïµ
```{r eval=FALSE}
path_output <- "H:/From_SUND/Scripts/outputs"
```


### Conduct 
```{r eval=FALSE}
source(paste0(path_utils_DBs_api, "/DBs_api.R"))

```

# Troubleshooting

## FTP (transfer local files to server of GNPS)
1. When upload files via FTP, meet the error "Unrecognized CURL options: connectiontimeout"

   **Solution**: 
     wait for a while and run the codes again. Or try to open the software "WinSCP" to see whether it works manually.



## Download files from GNPS platform
1. Warning: cannot open file 'xx.zip': No such file or directory Error infile(file.path(outputs_folder, paste0(workflow, ".zip")), "wb") : cannot open the connection

   **Solution**: 
     1. assign $download\_path$ with C/: drive instead H/: or J/: drive

     2. or remove "recursive = TRUE"

<!--chapter:end:05-Troubleshooting.Rmd-->
